intro: Hieracium defloccatum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and bright yellow flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in open habitats such as meadows and grasslands, preferring well-drained soils. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its stems are often reddish in color. Hieracium defloccatum is native to Europe and parts of Asia, and it is considered a herbaceous perennial.
